action.action-desc: Mrs. Lee of Nevada (for herself and Mr. Tony Gonzales of Texas) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Labor

form.official-title: To direct the Secretary of Education to establish a program to assist certain schools with respect to the implementation of wraparound services, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Communities Serving Schools Act of 2021.

subsection.text: From the amounts appropriated under subsection (f), the Secretary of Education shall award grants, on a competitive basis, to State educational agencies or local educational agencies in order to provide, to eligible schools, wraparound services that address out-of-school factors that interfere with learning.

paragraph.text: To be eligible for a grant under this section, a State educational agency or local educational agency shall submit to the Secretary an application in such form, at such time, and containing such information as the Secretary determines appropriate.

To be eligible for a subgrant under this section, a local educational agency shall submit to the appropriate State educational agency an application in such form, at such time, and containing such information as the State educational agency determines appropriate.

paragraph.header: Use of funds by State educational agency
paragraph.text: A State educational agency that receives grant funds under subsection (a) shall use such funds to award subgrants to local educational agencies served by the State educational agency.

paragraph.header: Use of funds by local educational agency
paragraph.text: A local educational agency that receives grant funds under subsection (a) or subgrant funds under paragraph (1) shall use the funds for the following activities for each eligible school served by the local educational agency:

subparagraph.text: Implementing a planning period that involves—

clause.text: assessing the needs and strengths of the school; and
selecting relevant programs and tiered supports that match the individual needs of each student.

subparagraph.text: Partnering with a nonprofit or community-based organization with a demonstrated record of providing high-quality, evidence-based wraparound services for children.
Hiring an on-site coordinator who will—

clause.text: ensure wraparound services are aligned with student needs; and
connect students to the right services and supports in an efficient manner.

subparagraph.text: Ensuring integration of wraparound services within the school.
Tracking data on an annual basis.

subsection.text: A grant or subgrant awarded under this section shall be for a 4-year period.
With respect to a 4-year grant period, a local educational agency may only receive a grant or a subgrant under this section for such grant period.

paragraph.text: Not later than 2 years after the date on which the first grant is awarded under this section, and 2 years thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to Congress a report (with information disaggregated in accordance with paragraph (2)) including—

subparagraph.text: with respect to an eligible school receiving assistance under this section, descriptions of any changes relating to—

clause.text: rate of promotion to the following grade;

subclause.text: issues that harm the well-being of a student; and
issues that put a student at risk of not graduating;

subparagraph.text: recommendations with respect to best practices for implementing high-quality wraparound services in elementary and secondary schools, including with respect to—

clause.text: conducting assessments of the needs and strengths of a school; and

subparagraph.text: The information described under paragraph (1)(A), with respect to a school, shall be disaggregated, where appropriate, by—

clause.text: all students enrolled in such school; and

subparagraph.text: The information disaggregated in accordance with clauses (i) and (ii) of subparagraph (A) shall be further disaggregated by—

subsection.text: There are authorized to be appropriated to carry out this section $1,000,000,000.

subparagraph.text: The terms elementary school, local educational agency, secondary school, and State educational agency have the meanings given such terms in section 8101 of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 7801).
The term eligible school attendance area has the meaning given such term in section 1113(a)(2) of the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965 (20 U.S.C. 6313(a)(2)).

paragraph.text: The term eligible school means a public elementary school or secondary school that serves an eligible school attendance area.
The term wraparound service means a school-based service that targets academic and non-academic barriers to student achievement, including—

subparagraph.text: provision of basic needs (including food, housing, and clothing);
